newsitem.title: USA: FTP sees Q3 charge, Q2 oper loss $13.7-14.2 mln.
newsitem.headline: FTP sees Q3 charge, Q2 oper loss $13.7-14.2 mln.

text.p: FTP Software Inc said on Thursday it expects to report a charge in the third quarter ending September 30 in the range of $13 to $16 million, or $0.38 to $0.47 per share, from its restructuring.
FTP said the charge will account for a reduction in its worldwide workforce of approximately 38 percent, consolidation of facilities and a reduction of associated physical assets.

In addition, the company expects to report a second quarter operating loss from continuing operations before taxes in the range of $13.7 to $14.2 million and revenue in the range of $17.4 to $17.8 million.
The company said it would realign its business into three units, the VIP Network Applications Business, IP Technology Business and Agent/Directory Business units.

The VIP unit will develop desktop and Web-based network application solutions, the IP unit will develop server based connectivity solutions and the Agent/Directory unit will develop next generation network administration and management applications.

Glenn Hazard, chairman and chief executive officer, said in a statement, "These strategic business units allow us to focus our effort and resources in those areas that provide the most benefit to our customers."

"To create a path toward a successful future for these three business units and return the company to a more solid financial position, we have taken significant actions to align our resources appropriately," concluded Hazard.
The company expects to substantially complete the planned associated actions by the end of the third quarter.
FTP said it will publish its final second quarter revenue results on July 23.

First Call analysts estimate FTP will report a second quarter loss per share of $0.25. The company had previously announced that it would not meet its internal expectations for the second quarter ended June 30.
FTP produces internetworking software enabling personal computer users to access heterogeneous resources across local area, enterprise wide and global networks.
